net.rithms.riot.api.request

Class AsyncRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.rithms.riot.api.request.Request
      • net.rithms.riot.api.request.AsyncRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AsyncRequest
extends Request
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is used to fire asynchronous call at the Riot Api. You should not construct these requests manually. To fire asynchronous requests, use a RiotApiAsync object.
    Author:
    Daniel 'Linnun' Figge
    See Also:
    RiotApiAsync

    • Method Detail

      • addListeners

        public void addListeners(RequestListener... listeners)

      • await

        public void await()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits indefinitely until the request completes.

        If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the request to complete, this method will throw an InterruptedException and the thread's interrupt flag will be cleared.

        Please note that this method is blocking and thus negates the advantage of the asynchronous nature of this class. Consider using a RequestListener instead.

        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the method is interrupted by calling Thread.interrupt(). The interrupt flag will be cleared

      • await

        public void await(long timeout,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits for at most the given time until the request completes.

        If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the request to complete, this method will throw an InterruptedException and the thread's interrupt flag will be cleared.

        Please note that this method is blocking and thus negates the advantage of the asynchronous nature of this class. Consider using a RequestListener instead.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of the given time unit to wait
        unit - The time unit of the timeout argument
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the method is interrupted by calling Thread.interrupt(). The interrupt flag will be cleared
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If the given time elapsed without the request completing

      • await

        public void await(long timeout,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                  boolean cancelOnTimeout)
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Waits for at most the given time until the request completes.

        If the thread is interrupted while waiting for the request to complete, this method will throw an InterruptedException and the thread's interrupt flag will be cleared.

        Please note that this method is blocking and thus negates the advantage of the asynchronous nature of this class. Consider using a RequestListener instead.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The maximum amount of the given time unit to wait
        unit - The time unit of the timeout argument
        cancelOnTimeout - Whether or not the request should be cancelled, if the given timeout is elapsed without the request completing
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the method is interrupted by calling Thread.interrupt(). The interrupt flag will be cleared
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If the given time elapsed without the request completing

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel()
        Description copied from class: Request
        Attempts to cancel the request. This attempt will fail if the request has already been completed, or could not be cancelled for some other reason. If successful, and this request has not started when cancel is called, this request should never run.
        Overrides:
        cancel in class Request
        Returns:
        false if the request could not be cancelled, typically because it has already completed normally; true otherwise

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Description copied from class: Request
        Executes the request

      • getDto

        public <T> T getDto()
        Retrieves the request's result. If an exception would be thrown, it is swallowed, since you should only call this method, if the request succeeded.

        If you want this method to throw exceptions, please use getDtoAndThrowException() instead.

        Overrides:
        getDto in class Request
        Returns:
        The object returned by the api call, or null if the request did not finish yet

      • getDtoAndThrowException

        public <T> T getDtoAndThrowException()
                              throws RiotApiException
        Retrieves the request's result. If an exception occures, it is thrown.

        If you do not want this method to throw exceptions, please use getDto() instead.

        Returns:
        The object returned by the api call, or null if the request did not finish yet
        Throws:
        RiotApiException - If an exception occurs while parsing the Riot Api's response

      • isSent

        public boolean isSent()
        Returns true if this request has started execution
        Returns:
        true if this request has started execution
